channel.title: Router took a shIT
channel.description:
I had a server online, my first server, with a DLink router. I managed to portforward finally, after trying to remember the routers password. Day 3 of my server being up 24/7, my router fried. I got a linksys router, and I followed the guide on portforward.com and the guide in the tutorials section on how to portforward it. I did everything correctly. It is also allowed in my firewall.
I am thinking its the ip address that makes you connect to it, but it doesn't work. When I portforwarded the DLink, I looked at my start>connect to>wireless network connection, clicked advanced and the ipaddress that was there worked on there. Now with a new router, it says the same thing but it doesn't work.
Help please

item.title: Router took a shIT
item.dc:creator: @Alphaspida Alphaspida
item.description:
@Alphaspida wrote:

I had a server online, my first server, with a DLink router. I managed to portforward finally, after trying to remember the routers password. Day 3 of my server being up 24/7, my router fried. I got a linksys router, and I followed the guide on portforward.com and the guide in the tutorials section on how to portforward it. I did everything correctly. It is also allowed in my firewall.

I am thinking its the ip address that makes you connect to it, but it doesn’t work. When I portforwarded the DLink, I looked at my start>connect to>wireless network connection, clicked advanced and the ipaddress that was there worked on there. Now with a new router, it says the same thing but it doesn’t work.

Help please
